website_summaries.verdict: With a 110,000-word database and multiple spelling games, this model is a good option for children to learn spelling while having fun.
pros: Large word database is a nice feature of this model, and it is intuitive about phonetically recognizing the word a user is trying to spell
Alerts users when one word might be confused with another, and includes a crossword puzzle solver for game players
Six built-in games include Hangman and Word Builder, all intended to make learning to spell a fun exercise
cons: While the spell check feature is thorough, this model is not a traditional dictionary, and does not include word meanings

customer_reviews.title: I am a very bad speller. So you can imaging how often I ...
customer_reviews.text: I am a very bad speller. So you can imaging how often I use this a day. I can not be without it. Hell I had to use it just now to make sure I spelled IMAGING the right way. LOL !!
customer_reviews.author: Norma Guzman

customer_reviews.title: Broken after less than two months
customer_reviews.text: UGH! Got nearly two months ago. It has already malfunctioned. When turned on, it just begins to type zzzzzzzzzzzz until the entire screen is filled up with z's and then it flashes between that and stating "No more!"
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Great product at great price
customer_reviews.text: I bought four of these for my sixth grade class. They are great!! Type in any word spelled phonetically, even very far off, and it comes up with the correct choice of words every time, usually the first choice, or if that one isn't right then second choice is. Remarkable! And the price is much less than comparable spelling correctors.
customer_reviews.author: Mary L. Quijano

customer_reviews.title: um, what does it want to be when it ...
customer_reviews.text: um, what does it want to be when it grows up. It is smaller than a petite woman's palm, I have slender fingers and it is challenging to tap the keys. It looks so flimsy, I'm afraid to put it even in my pocketbook, let alone my tote for school.
customer_reviews.author: patricia porcello

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Had one prior to this for at least 15 years that's why when looking for another I chose Webster.
customer_reviews.author: iola s

customer_reviews.title: It is so small I can not see the keys ...
customer_reviews.text: It is so small I can not see the keys with out a bright lite and my glasses and it is almost impossible to hit one key at a time instead If I didn t need it right now I would return it immediately!!
customer_reviews.author: Ellens sportyretorts

customer_reviews.title: Good for crossword puzzles
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little speller. It even has some games in it.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Petronzio

customer_reviews.title: A good product. I thought that I would use it ...
customer_reviews.text: A good product. I thought that I would use it a lot, but most of the time, it sits in my night stand drawer. I do use it once in a while.
customer_reviews.author: rufone89048

customer_reviews.title: Adult users and students need something more sophisticated.
customer_reviews.text: The time spent in looking up a word in a paper dictionary would be greatly reduced by not using this device first. Perhaps it is ok for the first few grades in elementary school. Extremely low miss-spelling correction and word recognition ability.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Walker

customer_reviews.title: Very small, pocket size
customer_reviews.text: This is much smaller than expected. I got it for my grandmother to use with her cross word puzzles & she couldn’t use it.
customer_reviews.author: HonestAndTrue

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Will not order another from this manufacturer. Did not even last two months.
customer_reviews.author: Sandi

customer_reviews.title: Quit after two weeks
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for use with writing intervention students. I was so sad when they quit working after about two weeks. They were a major asset for the kids; they were so excited and did great with them. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Emilee Epple

customer_reviews.title: Success is important to young students. This resource is useful to them.
customer_reviews.text: I work with students 2nd-5th grades. When they misspell a word it is difficult for them to "look it up". They often leave it uncorrected because you can't look up something you don't know how to spell in a normal dictionary. They want to do their work correctly, now they are excited; they can find the correct spelling themselves!
customer_reviews.author: Glenda Hale

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't Do Puzzles Without This
customer_reviews.text: My mother used her Webster's Spelling Corrector for years. It finally died, and she panicked because she used it when she worked on puzzles. I ordered her this online and got it the next day. She was so delighted, and has been using it every day.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be able to held easier.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the little guy, but it can use some adjusting. It can be another inch down and some kind of light in the viewing window and the viewing window could be a little wider.

product_meta.title: Webster's Spelling Corrector NCS-100
product_meta.description: Webster's Spelling Corrector NCS-100 by Franklin
feature_bullets: Word count (as provided by Merriam-Webster): Over 110,000 words.
Features Phonetic Spell Correction (type the word like it sounds).
Confusables function to alert you when one word might be confused with another (their vs. there vs. they're) by providing spellings.
Crossword Puzzle Solver and Matchmaker 6 educational games: Anagrams, Hangman, Jumble, User Anagrams, User Hangman, and, Word Builder.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars210 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
